title: Lavani
short_description: Known for its powerful rhythm and erotic sentiment, performed to the beats of the Dholki.
long_description:
Lavani is a genre of music and dance popular in Maharashtra. It is a combination of traditional song and dance, which particularly performed to the beats of 'Dholki', a percussion instrument. Lavani is noted for its powerful rhythm and erotic sentiment. Lavani has contributed substantially to the development of Marathi folk theatre. 

Lavani is performed by women wearing a nine-yard saree. The songs are sung in a quick tempo. Originating from the Peshwa rule in the 18th century, it was a morale booster for tired soldiers.
costume_and_makeup: Nauvari (9-yard) saree worn in the Maharashtrian style. Heavy jewelry and a distinctive Nath (nose ring).

top_places.title: Pune
top_places.summary: The cultural capital of Maharashtra where Lavani flourished.

practical_info.audience_tips: It is high energy and often includes satire.
